release.description: Changes since last milestone for this upcoming major release.
release.action: Updated parent dependencies.
Most Committers (those relying on FSQueue) now have the ability to retry failing batches as is, as well as reducing their size before retrying again.
New CSVFileCommitter (comma-separated values).
New LogCommitter.
New MemoryCommitter.
New ability to restrict committing to only matching documents (to facilitate "routing").
Batch and queuing now separate to favor reuse.
New "init", "close", "accept", and "clean" methods for Committers.
Now fire Committer events for interested consuming classes.
New support for field mappings.
New option to commit leftovers (e.g., from being stopped early) from previous execution at initialization time.
No more "commit" method. Batching has the concept of batch "consumer" and a new "close" method replaces it.
The "add" operation is now "upsert" (update or insert). Now fire Committer events for interested consuming classes. The "remove" operation is now "delete".
Documents are now committed via UsertRequest and DeleteRequest objects.
For Committers supporting batches, "queueSize" and "commitBatchSize" configuration options are now merged into "batchSize". Now when a batch queue is full, the whole batch is sent.
Maven dependency updates: Norconex Commons Lang 2.0.0, Junit 5.
Version 3 classes package structure has *.core3.* in it.
Now using XML class from Norconex Commons lang for loading/saving configuration.
Now using SLF4J for logging.
Now requires Java 8 or higher.
Removed some of the deprecated code from 1.x.
